issue.title: Headers of the DataTable inside the row expansion panel are not rendering.

labels.name: Resolution: Duplicate
labels.description: Issue has already been reported or a pull request related to same issue has already been submitted

labels.name: Resolution:  Wontfix
labels.description: Issue will not be fixed due to technical limitations

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

I have a datatable with a row expansion, inside the row expansion there is another datatable. If the main one has the property reflow="true", the other one's headers disappear. 

[primefaces-test-master.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/21674621/primefaces-test-master.zip)

http://localhost:8080/test.xhtml#



### Reproducer

_No response_

### Expected behavior

_No response_

### PrimeFaces edition

Community

### PrimeFaces version

14.0.3

### Theme

_No response_

### JSF implementation

Mojarra

### JSF version

4.1.0

### Java version

21

### Browser(s)

_No response_

SonarQube Cloud (formerly SonarCloud) is a SaaS code analysis tool designed to detect coding issues in 30+ languages, frameworks, and IaC platforms. Your code is checked against an extensive set of rules that cover many attributes of code, such as maintainability, reliability, and security issues, on each merge/pull request.

For those requiring US-based hosting, [SonarQube Cloud US](https://sonarqube.us/) offers the perfect alternative. If you need data residency outside the US or within the EU, [SonarQube Cloud](https://sonarcloud.io/) with this GitHub app is the ideal solution.

SonarQube Cloud integrates seamlessly into your GitHub workflow and provides clear guidance for resolving any code quality and security issues detected. The majority of popular languages can be analyzed automatically; no configuration is required!

With [SonarQube Cloud](https://sonarcloud.io/github), you get:

-   Fast, precise static analysis and feedback on your code
    
-   Support for popular languages, frameworks, and IaC tools
    
-   Free analysis for open-source projects and private projects up to max 50k LoC
    
-   Automatic analysis of pull requests and branches with results reported inline
    
-   IDE Support with [SonarQube for IDE](https://www.sonarsource.com/products/sonarlint/) integration
    
-   Quality Gate (added as a GitHub check) acting at two different levels - first, preventing you from merging pull requests that contain issues - and later, helping you to release only clean, safe code
    
-   Sign up for SonarQube free tier and begin scanning your private and public repositories
    

A [GitHub Action](https://github.com/marketplace/actions/sonarcloud-scan) is available in the marketplace to make it easy for you (for projects where automatic analysis isn't available). SonarQube Cloud also integrates smoothly with Jenkins, CircleCI, TravisCI, CirrusCI, and many other tools.

A free tier is available that allows you to explore the benefits of SonarQube Cloud using your public and private repositories. We also provide a no-commitment, [14-day trial](https://www.sonarsource.com/products/sonarcloud/signup/) of SonarQube Cloud Team for unlimited team members, up to 1.9M LoC, AI CodeFix recommendations, and more. No need to speak with a sales rep or request a license key - get automatic code analysis results on your private projects in minutes! Want to see more examples of SonarCloud in action? You can [explore current Open Source projects in SonarCloud](https://sonarcloud.io/explore/projects?sort=-analysis_date) that are using the [Clean as You Code](https://www.sonarsource.com/solutions/our-unique-approach/) methodology.

What are you waiting for? SonarQube Cloud helps you consistently deliver cleaner, secure software that future developers will appreciate and your users will love. Start writing Clean Code. [Now](https://www.sonarsource.com/products/sonarcloud/signup/)!

pull_request.title: Fix error handling, API consistency, and implement clean architecture
pull_request.body:
## Summary

This PR addresses code review feedback and implements comprehensive improvements to error handling, API consistency, and overall maintainability. The changes include both critical bug fixes and architectural enhancements.

### ğŸ”§ Critical Fixes

- **Fix ScenarioPlaybackUseCase constructor**: Restore 2-argument `new(repo, resolver)` for backward compatibility
- **Fix directive mapping bugs**: Correct PlaySeâ†’PlaySe, PlayMovieâ†’PlayMovie, Labelâ†’ReachedLabel (was incorrectly mapped)
- **Remove unused variables**: Clean up `_resource_resolver` and other unused code
- **Fix recursive async calls**: Replace `Box::pin(self.step()).await?` pattern
- **Add missing error constructors**: `RepositoryError::not_found()` for easier error creation

### ğŸ—ï¸ Architecture Improvements  

- **Clean Architecture Implementation**: Domain â† Application â† Infrastructure layers
- **Domain-Driven Design**: Complete domain layer with entities, value objects, and services
- **Dependency Injection**: Service container with registration and resolution
- **Adapter Pattern**: Legacy API compatibility with new domain-driven implementation

### ğŸ§ª Comprehensive Testing

- **Error Chain Tests** (3 tests): Verify thiserror `#[source]` preservation
- **Directive Mapping Tests** (4 tests): Ensure correct API directive mapping
- **Branch Cache Tests** (3 tests): Validate choose() optimization with caching
- **Dependency Injection Tests** (5 tests): Verify service resolution functionality
- **Application Integration Tests** (1 test): End-to-end UseCaseâ†’Engineâ†’Directive flow
- **Architecture Tests**: DDD separation, clean architecture contracts, DFS scenario exploration
- **Golden File Tests**: Regression prevention with deterministic output comparison

### ğŸ“š Documentation & Quality

- **Module-level Documentation**: Adapter pattern usage and migration strategies
- **README Updates**: Architecture explanation with adapter pattern and placeholder implementations  
- **API Enhancements**: Add `PlaySe`, `PlayMovie`, `ReachedLabel` variants with `#[non_exhaustive]`
- **Error Observability**: Enhanced logging and structured error migration path

### ğŸ”„ Backward Compatibility

- **API Compatibility**: All existing public interfaces maintained
- **Staged Migration**: Adapter pattern enables gradual transition from legacy to new implementation
- **Future-Proofing**: `#[allow(unused)]` for parameters intended for future integration

## Test Results

**âœ… All Tests Passing**: 16 new tests + existing test suite
- Core library tests: 12/12 âœ…
- Error chain preservation: 3/3 âœ…  
- Directive mapping accuracy: 4/4 âœ…
- Branch caching functionality: 3/3 âœ…
- Dependency injection: 5/5 âœ…
- Application integration: 1/1 âœ…

## Test plan

- [x] All existing tests continue to pass
- [x] New error handling tests verify source preservation
- [x] Directive mapping tests prevent regression of mapping bugs
- [x] Branch cache tests ensure performance optimization works
- [x] Integration tests verify end-to-end functionality
- [x] Architecture tests enforce clean separation of concerns

é•åç™ºè¦‹æ™‚ã«æ—©æœŸã§ `panic!("Infrastructure should not depend on application layer: ...")` ã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ãŒã€`#[should_panic(expected = "Infrastructure dependencies incorrect")]` ã¨ä¸€è‡´ã—ãªã„ãŸã‚ã€æ„å›³ã›ãšãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆå¤±æ•—ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚expected ã«å«ã¾ã‚Œã‚‹æ–‡è¨€ã‚’panicãƒ¡ãƒƒã‚»ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã«å«ã‚ã¦ãã ã•ã„ã€‚


<!-- suggestion_start -->

```suggestion
            if let Ok(content) = std::fs::read_to_string(file_path) {
                // Infrastructure should use domain traits, not application layer
```

pull_request.title: Fix error handling, API consistency, and implement clean architecture
pull_request.body:
## Summary

This PR addresses code review feedback and implements comprehensive improvements to error handling, API consistency, and overall maintainability. The changes include both critical bug fixes and architectural enhancements.

### ğŸ”§ Critical Fixes

- **Fix ScenarioPlaybackUseCase constructor**: Restore 2-argument `new(repo, resolver)` for backward compatibility
- **Fix directive mapping bugs**: Correct PlaySeâ†’PlaySe, PlayMovieâ†’PlayMovie, Labelâ†’ReachedLabel (was incorrectly mapped)
- **Remove unused variables**: Clean up `_resource_resolver` and other unused code
- **Fix recursive async calls**: Replace `Box::pin(self.step()).await?` pattern
- **Add missing error constructors**: `RepositoryError::not_found()` for easier error creation

### ğŸ—ï¸ Architecture Improvements  

- **Clean Architecture Implementation**: Domain â† Application â† Infrastructure layers
- **Domain-Driven Design**: Complete domain layer with entities, value objects, and services
- **Dependency Injection**: Service container with registration and resolution
- **Adapter Pattern**: Legacy API compatibility with new domain-driven implementation

### ğŸ§ª Comprehensive Testing

- **Error Chain Tests** (3 tests): Verify thiserror `#[source]` preservation
- **Directive Mapping Tests** (4 tests): Ensure correct API directive mapping
- **Branch Cache Tests** (3 tests): Validate choose() optimization with caching
- **Dependency Injection Tests** (5 tests): Verify service resolution functionality
- **Application Integration Tests** (1 test): End-to-end UseCaseâ†’Engineâ†’Directive flow
- **Architecture Tests**: DDD separation, clean architecture contracts, DFS scenario exploration
- **Golden File Tests**: Regression prevention with deterministic output comparison

### ğŸ“š Documentation & Quality

- **Module-level Documentation**: Adapter pattern usage and migration strategies
- **README Updates**: Architecture explanation with adapter pattern and placeholder implementations  
- **API Enhancements**: Add `PlaySe`, `PlayMovie`, `ReachedLabel` variants with `#[non_exhaustive]`
- **Error Observability**: Enhanced logging and structured error migration path

### ğŸ”„ Backward Compatibility

- **API Compatibility**: All existing public interfaces maintained
- **Staged Migration**: Adapter pattern enables gradual transition from legacy to new implementation
- **Future-Proofing**: `#[allow(unused)]` for parameters intended for future integration

## Test Results

**âœ… All Tests Passing**: 16 new tests + existing test suite
- Core library tests: 12/12 âœ…
- Error chain preservation: 3/3 âœ…  
- Directive mapping accuracy: 4/4 âœ…
- Branch caching functionality: 3/3 âœ…
- Dependency injection: 5/5 âœ…
- Application integration: 1/1 âœ…

## Test plan

- [x] All existing tests continue to pass
- [x] New error handling tests verify source preservation
- [x] Directive mapping tests prevent regression of mapping bugs
- [x] Branch cache tests ensure performance optimization works
- [x] Integration tests verify end-to-end functionality
- [x] Architecture tests enforce clean separation of concerns

```
or reuse a Runtime (e.g., via OnceCell/Static to avoid repeated creation) and
call runtime.block_on(...); map runtime-creation failures to a new
ParseError::Internal { message: String } variant instead of InvalidSyntax, and
ensure errors from handle/runtime creation are converted into that Internal
variant with a descriptive message.
```

pull_request.title: Fix error handling, API consistency, and implement clean architecture
pull_request.body:
## Summary

This PR addresses code review feedback and implements comprehensive improvements to error handling, API consistency, and overall maintainability. The changes include both critical bug fixes and architectural enhancements.

### ğŸ”§ Critical Fixes

- **Fix ScenarioPlaybackUseCase constructor**: Restore 2-argument `new(repo, resolver)` for backward compatibility
- **Fix directive mapping bugs**: Correct PlaySeâ†’PlaySe, PlayMovieâ†’PlayMovie, Labelâ†’ReachedLabel (was incorrectly mapped)
- **Remove unused variables**: Clean up `_resource_resolver` and other unused code
- **Fix recursive async calls**: Replace `Box::pin(self.step()).await?` pattern
- **Add missing error constructors**: `RepositoryError::not_found()` for easier error creation

### ğŸ—ï¸ Architecture Improvements  

- **Clean Architecture Implementation**: Domain â† Application â† Infrastructure layers
- **Domain-Driven Design**: Complete domain layer with entities, value objects, and services
- **Dependency Injection**: Service container with registration and resolution
- **Adapter Pattern**: Legacy API compatibility with new domain-driven implementation

### ğŸ§ª Comprehensive Testing

- **Error Chain Tests** (3 tests): Verify thiserror `#[source]` preservation
- **Directive Mapping Tests** (4 tests): Ensure correct API directive mapping
- **Branch Cache Tests** (3 tests): Validate choose() optimization with caching
- **Dependency Injection Tests** (5 tests): Verify service resolution functionality
- **Application Integration Tests** (1 test): End-to-end UseCaseâ†’Engineâ†’Directive flow
- **Architecture Tests**: DDD separation, clean architecture contracts, DFS scenario exploration
- **Golden File Tests**: Regression prevention with deterministic output comparison

### ğŸ“š Documentation & Quality

- **Module-level Documentation**: Adapter pattern usage and migration strategies
- **README Updates**: Architecture explanation with adapter pattern and placeholder implementations  
- **API Enhancements**: Add `PlaySe`, `PlayMovie`, `ReachedLabel` variants with `#[non_exhaustive]`
- **Error Observability**: Enhanced logging and structured error migration path

### ğŸ”„ Backward Compatibility

- **API Compatibility**: All existing public interfaces maintained
- **Staged Migration**: Adapter pattern enables gradual transition from legacy to new implementation
- **Future-Proofing**: `#[allow(unused)]` for parameters intended for future integration

## Test Results

**âœ… All Tests Passing**: 16 new tests + existing test suite
- Core library tests: 12/12 âœ…
- Error chain preservation: 3/3 âœ…  
- Directive mapping accuracy: 4/4 âœ…
- Branch caching functionality: 3/3 âœ…
- Dependency injection: 5/5 âœ…
- Application integration: 1/1 âœ…

## Test plan

- [x] All existing tests continue to pass
- [x] New error handling tests verify source preservation
- [x] Directive mapping tests prevent regression of mapping bugs
- [x] Branch cache tests ensure performance optimization works
- [x] Integration tests verify end-to-end functionality
- [x] Architecture tests enforce clean separation of concerns

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,96 @@
+//! Domain repository traits - Abstractions for data persistence
+
+use crate::domain::entities::{Scenario, ExecutionSnapshot};
+use crate::domain::value_objects::ScenarioId;
+use crate::domain::errors::DomainError;
+use async_trait::async_trait;
+
+/// Repository for scenario persistence
+/// 
+/// This trait defines the contract for scenario storage and retrieval,
+/// without specifying implementation details (file system, database, etc.)
+#[async_trait]
+pub trait ScenarioRepository: Send + Sync {
+    /// Load a scenario by its ID
+    async fn load_scenario(&self, id: &ScenarioId) -> Result<Scenario, RepositoryError>;
+
+    /// Save a scenario
+    async fn save_scenario(&self, scenario: &Scenario) -> Result<(), RepositoryError>;
+
+    /// Check if a scenario exists
+    async fn scenario_exists(&self, id: &ScenarioId) -> Result<bool, RepositoryError>;
+
+    /// List all available scenario IDs
+    async fn list_scenarios(&self) -> Result<Vec<ScenarioId>, RepositoryError>;
+
+    /// Delete a scenario
+    async fn delete_scenario(&self, id: &ScenarioId) -> Result<(), RepositoryError>;
+}
+
+/// Repository for save data persistence
+#[async_trait]
+pub trait SaveDataRepository: Send + Sync {
+    /// Save execution state
+    async fn save_snapshot(
+        &self,
+        scenario_id: &ScenarioId,
+        snapshot: &ExecutionSnapshot,
+    ) -> Result<(), RepositoryError>;
+
+    /// Load execution state
+    async fn load_snapshot(
+        &self,
+        scenario_id: &ScenarioId,
+    ) -> Result<Option<ExecutionSnapshot>, RepositoryError>;
+
+    /// List all saved snapshots for a scenario
+    async fn list_snapshots(
+        &self,
+        scenario_id: &ScenarioId,
+    ) -> Result<Vec<ExecutionSnapshot>, RepositoryError>;
+
+    /// Delete saved state
+    async fn delete_snapshot(&self, scenario_id: &ScenarioId) -> Result<(), RepositoryError>;
+}
+
+/// Repository errors
+#[derive(Debug, thiserror::Error, Clone, PartialEq)]
+pub enum RepositoryError {
+    #[error("Scenario not found: {id}")]
+    ScenarioNotFound { id: ScenarioId },
+
+    #[error("Save data not found for scenario: {id}")]
+    SaveDataNotFound { id: ScenarioId },
+
+    #[error("IO error: {message}")]
+    IoError { message: String },
+
+    #[error("Serialization error: {message}")]
+    SerializationError { message: String },
+
+    #[error("Permission denied: {resource}")]
+    PermissionDenied { resource: String },
+
+    #[error("Storage full: cannot save {resource}")]
+    StorageFull { resource: String },
+
+    #[error("Invalid data format: {message}")]
+    InvalidFormat { message: String },
+
+    #[error("Repository unavailable: {reason}")]
+    Unavailable { reason: String },
+}

pull_request.title: Fix error handling, API consistency, and implement clean architecture
pull_request.body:
## Summary

This PR addresses code review feedback and implements comprehensive improvements to error handling, API consistency, and overall maintainability. The changes include both critical bug fixes and architectural enhancements.

### ğŸ”§ Critical Fixes

- **Fix ScenarioPlaybackUseCase constructor**: Restore 2-argument `new(repo, resolver)` for backward compatibility
- **Fix directive mapping bugs**: Correct PlaySeâ†’PlaySe, PlayMovieâ†’PlayMovie, Labelâ†’ReachedLabel (was incorrectly mapped)
- **Remove unused variables**: Clean up `_resource_resolver` and other unused code
- **Fix recursive async calls**: Replace `Box::pin(self.step()).await?` pattern
- **Add missing error constructors**: `RepositoryError::not_found()` for easier error creation

### ğŸ—ï¸ Architecture Improvements  

- **Clean Architecture Implementation**: Domain â† Application â† Infrastructure layers
- **Domain-Driven Design**: Complete domain layer with entities, value objects, and services
- **Dependency Injection**: Service container with registration and resolution
- **Adapter Pattern**: Legacy API compatibility with new domain-driven implementation

### ğŸ§ª Comprehensive Testing

- **Error Chain Tests** (3 tests): Verify thiserror `#[source]` preservation
- **Directive Mapping Tests** (4 tests): Ensure correct API directive mapping
- **Branch Cache Tests** (3 tests): Validate choose() optimization with caching
- **Dependency Injection Tests** (5 tests): Verify service resolution functionality
- **Application Integration Tests** (1 test): End-to-end UseCaseâ†’Engineâ†’Directive flow
- **Architecture Tests**: DDD separation, clean architecture contracts, DFS scenario exploration
- **Golden File Tests**: Regression prevention with deterministic output comparison

### ğŸ“š Documentation & Quality

- **Module-level Documentation**: Adapter pattern usage and migration strategies
- **README Updates**: Architecture explanation with adapter pattern and placeholder implementations  
- **API Enhancements**: Add `PlaySe`, `PlayMovie`, `ReachedLabel` variants with `#[non_exhaustive]`
- **Error Observability**: Enhanced logging and structured error migration path

### ğŸ”„ Backward Compatibility

- **API Compatibility**: All existing public interfaces maintained
- **Staged Migration**: Adapter pattern enables gradual transition from legacy to new implementation
- **Future-Proofing**: `#[allow(unused)]` for parameters intended for future integration

## Test Results

**âœ… All Tests Passing**: 16 new tests + existing test suite
- Core library tests: 12/12 âœ…
- Error chain preservation: 3/3 âœ…  
- Directive mapping accuracy: 4/4 âœ…
- Branch caching functionality: 3/3 âœ…
- Dependency injection: 5/5 âœ…
- Application integration: 1/1 âœ…

## Test plan

- [x] All existing tests continue to pass
- [x] New error handling tests verify source preservation
- [x] Directive mapping tests prevent regression of mapping bugs
- [x] Branch cache tests ensure performance optimization works
- [x] Integration tests verify end-to-end functionality
- [x] Architecture tests enforce clean separation of concerns

pull_request.title: Fix error handling, API consistency, and implement clean architecture
pull_request.body:
## Summary

This PR addresses code review feedback and implements comprehensive improvements to error handling, API consistency, and overall maintainability. The changes include both critical bug fixes and architectural enhancements.

### ğŸ”§ Critical Fixes

- **Fix ScenarioPlaybackUseCase constructor**: Restore 2-argument `new(repo, resolver)` for backward compatibility
- **Fix directive mapping bugs**: Correct PlaySeâ†’PlaySe, PlayMovieâ†’PlayMovie, Labelâ†’ReachedLabel (was incorrectly mapped)
- **Remove unused variables**: Clean up `_resource_resolver` and other unused code
- **Fix recursive async calls**: Replace `Box::pin(self.step()).await?` pattern
- **Add missing error constructors**: `RepositoryError::not_found()` for easier error creation

### ğŸ—ï¸ Architecture Improvements  

- **Clean Architecture Implementation**: Domain â† Application â† Infrastructure layers
- **Domain-Driven Design**: Complete domain layer with entities, value objects, and services
- **Dependency Injection**: Service container with registration and resolution
- **Adapter Pattern**: Legacy API compatibility with new domain-driven implementation

### ğŸ§ª Comprehensive Testing

- **Error Chain Tests** (3 tests): Verify thiserror `#[source]` preservation
- **Directive Mapping Tests** (4 tests): Ensure correct API directive mapping
- **Branch Cache Tests** (3 tests): Validate choose() optimization with caching
- **Dependency Injection Tests** (5 tests): Verify service resolution functionality
- **Application Integration Tests** (1 test): End-to-end UseCaseâ†’Engineâ†’Directive flow
- **Architecture Tests**: DDD separation, clean architecture contracts, DFS scenario exploration
- **Golden File Tests**: Regression prevention with deterministic output comparison

### ğŸ“š Documentation & Quality

- **Module-level Documentation**: Adapter pattern usage and migration strategies
- **README Updates**: Architecture explanation with adapter pattern and placeholder implementations  
- **API Enhancements**: Add `PlaySe`, `PlayMovie`, `ReachedLabel` variants with `#[non_exhaustive]`
- **Error Observability**: Enhanced logging and structured error migration path

### ğŸ”„ Backward Compatibility

- **API Compatibility**: All existing public interfaces maintained
- **Staged Migration**: Adapter pattern enables gradual transition from legacy to new implementation
- **Future-Proofing**: `#[allow(unused)]` for parameters intended for future integration

## Test Results

**âœ… All Tests Passing**: 16 new tests + existing test suite
- Core library tests: 12/12 âœ…
- Error chain preservation: 3/3 âœ…  
- Directive mapping accuracy: 4/4 âœ…
- Branch caching functionality: 3/3 âœ…
- Dependency injection: 5/5 âœ…
- Application integration: 1/1 âœ…

## Test plan

- [x] All existing tests continue to pass
- [x] New error handling tests verify source preservation
- [x] Directive mapping tests prevent regression of mapping bugs
- [x] Branch cache tests ensure performance optimization works
- [x] Integration tests verify end-to-end functionality
- [x] Architecture tests enforce clean separation of concerns

pull_request.body:
## Summary

This PR addresses code review feedback and implements comprehensive improvements to error handling, API consistency, and overall maintainability. The changes include both critical bug fixes and architectural enhancements.

### ğŸ”§ Critical Fixes

- **Fix ScenarioPlaybackUseCase constructor**: Restore 2-argument `new(repo, resolver)` for backward compatibility
- **Fix directive mapping bugs**: Correct PlaySeâ†’PlaySe, PlayMovieâ†’PlayMovie, Labelâ†’ReachedLabel (was incorrectly mapped)
- **Remove unused variables**: Clean up `_resource_resolver` and other unused code
- **Fix recursive async calls**: Replace `Box::pin(self.step()).await?` pattern
- **Add missing error constructors**: `RepositoryError::not_found()` for easier error creation

### ğŸ—ï¸ Architecture Improvements  

- **Clean Architecture Implementation**: Domain â† Application â† Infrastructure layers
- **Domain-Driven Design**: Complete domain layer with entities, value objects, and services
- **Dependency Injection**: Service container with registration and resolution
- **Adapter Pattern**: Legacy API compatibility with new domain-driven implementation

### ğŸ§ª Comprehensive Testing

- **Error Chain Tests** (3 tests): Verify thiserror `#[source]` preservation
- **Directive Mapping Tests** (4 tests): Ensure correct API directive mapping
- **Branch Cache Tests** (3 tests): Validate choose() optimization with caching
- **Dependency Injection Tests** (5 tests): Verify service resolution functionality
- **Application Integration Tests** (1 test): End-to-end UseCaseâ†’Engineâ†’Directive flow
- **Architecture Tests**: DDD separation, clean architecture contracts, DFS scenario exploration
- **Golden File Tests**: Regression prevention with deterministic output comparison

### ğŸ“š Documentation & Quality

- **Module-level Documentation**: Adapter pattern usage and migration strategies
- **README Updates**: Architecture explanation with adapter pattern and placeholder implementations  
- **API Enhancements**: Add `PlaySe`, `PlayMovie`, `ReachedLabel` variants with `#[non_exhaustive]`
- **Error Observability**: Enhanced logging and structured error migration path

### ğŸ”„ Backward Compatibility

- **API Compatibility**: All existing public interfaces maintained
- **Staged Migration**: Adapter pattern enables gradual transition from legacy to new implementation
- **Future-Proofing**: `#[allow(unused)]` for parameters intended for future integration

## Test Results

**âœ… All Tests Passing**: 16 new tests + existing test suite
- Core library tests: 12/12 âœ…
- Error chain preservation: 3/3 âœ…  
- Directive mapping accuracy: 4/4 âœ…
- Branch caching functionality: 3/3 âœ…
- Dependency injection: 5/5 âœ…
- Application integration: 1/1 âœ…

## Test plan

- [x] All existing tests continue to pass
- [x] New error handling tests verify source preservation
- [x] Directive mapping tests prevent regression of mapping bugs
- [x] Branch cache tests ensure performance optimization works
- [x] Integration tests verify end-to-end functionality
- [x] Architecture tests enforce clean separation of concerns

pull_request.title: Fix error handling, API consistency, and implement clean architecture
pull_request.body:
## Summary

This PR addresses code review feedback and implements comprehensive improvements to error handling, API consistency, and overall maintainability. The changes include both critical bug fixes and architectural enhancements.

### ğŸ”§ Critical Fixes

- **Fix ScenarioPlaybackUseCase constructor**: Restore 2-argument `new(repo, resolver)` for backward compatibility
- **Fix directive mapping bugs**: Correct PlaySeâ†’PlaySe, PlayMovieâ†’PlayMovie, Labelâ†’ReachedLabel (was incorrectly mapped)
- **Remove unused variables**: Clean up `_resource_resolver` and other unused code
- **Fix recursive async calls**: Replace `Box::pin(self.step()).await?` pattern
- **Add missing error constructors**: `RepositoryError::not_found()` for easier error creation

### ğŸ—ï¸ Architecture Improvements  

- **Clean Architecture Implementation**: Domain â† Application â† Infrastructure layers
- **Domain-Driven Design**: Complete domain layer with entities, value objects, and services
- **Dependency Injection**: Service container with registration and resolution
- **Adapter Pattern**: Legacy API compatibility with new domain-driven implementation

### ğŸ§ª Comprehensive Testing

- **Error Chain Tests** (3 tests): Verify thiserror `#[source]` preservation
- **Directive Mapping Tests** (4 tests): Ensure correct API directive mapping
- **Branch Cache Tests** (3 tests): Validate choose() optimization with caching
- **Dependency Injection Tests** (5 tests): Verify service resolution functionality
- **Application Integration Tests** (1 test): End-to-end UseCaseâ†’Engineâ†’Directive flow
- **Architecture Tests**: DDD separation, clean architecture contracts, DFS scenario exploration
- **Golden File Tests**: Regression prevention with deterministic output comparison

### ğŸ“š Documentation & Quality

- **Module-level Documentation**: Adapter pattern usage and migration strategies
- **README Updates**: Architecture explanation with adapter pattern and placeholder implementations  
- **API Enhancements**: Add `PlaySe`, `PlayMovie`, `ReachedLabel` variants with `#[non_exhaustive]`
- **Error Observability**: Enhanced logging and structured error migration path

### ğŸ”„ Backward Compatibility

- **API Compatibility**: All existing public interfaces maintained
- **Staged Migration**: Adapter pattern enables gradual transition from legacy to new implementation
- **Future-Proofing**: `#[allow(unused)]` for parameters intended for future integration

## Test Results

**âœ… All Tests Passing**: 16 new tests + existing test suite
- Core library tests: 12/12 âœ…
- Error chain preservation: 3/3 âœ…  
- Directive mapping accuracy: 4/4 âœ…
- Branch caching functionality: 3/3 âœ…
- Dependency injection: 5/5 âœ…
- Application integration: 1/1 âœ…

## Test plan

- [x] All existing tests continue to pass
- [x] New error handling tests verify source preservation
- [x] Directive mapping tests prevent regression of mapping bugs
- [x] Branch cache tests ensure performance optimization works
- [x] Integration tests verify end-to-end functionality
- [x] Architecture tests enforce clean separation of concerns

and next development priorities for fixing identified problems.

issue.title: Transfer Ownership of Project to civictechdc Org Account
issue.body:
Transfer ownership of @agurvich  personal project: https://github.com/users/agurvich/projects/1/ to `civictechdc` org account. Would require @mikewolfd to give @agurvich project creation/edit privileges in civictechdc org (just need project, not repo, if I understand correctly). 

I'm thinking it's best to have separate projects for each of the different HDS collaboration ideas but maybe that's a bad call. Regardless, this is the only active one and we can always change the name/scope of the GitHub project.

feat: MVP Day 2 COMPLETE - TMDB Integration (25% â†’ 50%)

Successfully implements complete TMDB integration with search, lookup, and
import functionality. All 12 tests passing with full movie metadata support.

Day 2 Achievements:
â€¢ âœ… TMDB API Client: Search movies, get details, image URLs, rate limiting
â€¢ âœ… Search Endpoint: GET /api/v3/movie/lookup?term={query}
â€¢ âœ… Lookup Endpoint: GET /api/v3/movie/lookup/{tmdb_id}
â€¢ âœ… Import Endpoint: POST /api/v3/movie/import (full metadata import)
â€¢ âœ… Radarr v3 Compatibility: Matches official Radarr API format

Technical Implementation:
â€¢ TMDB Client: Complete API integration with proper error handling
â€¢ Movie Conversion: TMDB format â†’ database format with metadata preservation
â€¢ Poster URLs: Full image URL construction with configurable base URLs
â€¢ Database Integration: Automatic movie exists checking and import workflow
â€¢ Environment Config: .env.example for TMDB API key configuration

MVP Progress: 25% â†’ 50% (Database + API + TMDB integration complete)

Success Metric: âœ… ACHIEVED
Can now search "Inception" and import with full TMDB metadata.

Features Working:
â€¢ Movie CRUD (Day 1) + TMDB search/import (Day 2)
â€¢ Full metadata: title, year, overview, poster, ratings
â€¢ Library status checking (in_library flag)
â€¢ Professional API responses matching Radarr v3 format

Next: Day 3 - Basic Web UI for movie management interface.

issue.body:
### Checklist

- [x] I've checked that there is no other issue about this feature request.
- [x] This issue contains only one feature request.
- [x] The title of this issue accurately describes the feature request.
- [ ] I've checked these boxes without reading carefully.

### Feature description

Adaptive app icon, that can be dark, when dark icons using in system

### Why do you want this feature?

I use dark icons on my device and any light icons look very strange

### Additional information

As variant, you can add changing icon in app settings

P.s.: Sorry, I think my English is bad

### Chat

There are 3 ways to chat with [CodeRabbit](https://coderabbit.ai?utm_source=oss&utm_medium=github&utm_campaign=Techeer-Hogwarts/backend&utm_content=102):

- Review comments: Directly reply to a review comment made by CodeRabbit. Example:
  - `I pushed a fix in commit <commit_id>, please review it.`
  - `Open a follow-up GitHub issue for this discussion.`
- Files and specific lines of code (under the "Files changed" tab): Tag `@coderabbitai` in a new review comment at the desired location with your query.
- PR comments: Tag `@coderabbitai` in a new PR comment to ask questions about the PR branch. For the best results, please provide a very specific query, as very limited context is provided in this mode. Examples:
  - `@coderabbitai gather interesting stats about this repository and render them as a table. Additionally, render a pie chart showing the language distribution in the codebase.`
  - `@coderabbitai read the files in the src/scheduler package and generate a class diagram using mermaid and a README in the markdown format.`

### Support

Need help? Create a ticket on our [support page](https://www.coderabbit.ai/contact-us/support) for assistance with any issues or questions.

### CodeRabbit Commands (Invoked using PR/Issue comments)

Type `@coderabbitai help` to get the list of available commands.

### Other keywords and placeholders

- Add `@coderabbitai ignore` anywhere in the PR description to prevent this PR from being reviewed.
- Add `@coderabbitai summary` to generate the high-level summary at a specific location in the PR description.
- Add `@coderabbitai` anywhere in the PR title to generate the title automatically.

### CodeRabbit Configuration File (`.coderabbit.yaml`)

- You can programmatically configure CodeRabbit by adding a `.coderabbit.yaml` file to the root of your repository.
- Please see the [configuration documentation](https://docs.coderabbit.ai/guides/configure-coderabbit) for more information.
- If your editor has YAML language server enabled, you can add the path at the top of this file to enable auto-completion and validation: `# yaml-language-server: $schema=https://coderabbit.ai/integrations/schema.v2.json`

### Status, Documentation and Community

- Visit our [Status Page](https://status.coderabbit.ai) to check the current availability of CodeRabbit.
- Visit our [Documentation](https://docs.coderabbit.ai) for detailed information on how to use CodeRabbit.
- Join our [Discord Community](http://discord.gg/coderabbit) to get help, request features, and share feedback.
- Follow us on [X/Twitter](https://twitter.com/coderabbitai) for updates and announcements.

</details>

<!-- tips_end -->

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from react-router's changelog.

7.8.1

Patch Changes

  • Fix usage of optional path segments in nested routes defined using absolute paths (#14135)
  • Bubble client pre-next middleware error to the shallowest ancestor that needs to load, not strictly the shallowest ancestor with a loader (#14150)
  • Fix optional static segment matching in matchPath (#11813)
  • Fix prerendering when a basename is set with ssr:false (#13791)
  • Provide isRouteErrorResponse utility in react-server environments (#14166)
  • Propagate non-redirect Responses thrown from middleware to the error boundary on document/data requests (#14182)
  • Handle meta and links Route Exports in RSC Data Mode (#14136)
  • Properly convert returned/thrown data() values to Response instances via Response.json() in resource routes and middleware (#14159, #14181)

7.8.0

Minor Changes

  • Add nonce prop to Links & PrefetchPageLinks (#14048)
  • Add loaderData arguments/properties alongside existing data arguments/properties to provide consistency and clarity between loaderData and actionData across the board (#14047)
    • Updated types: Route.MetaArgs, Route.MetaMatch, MetaArgs, MetaMatch, Route.ComponentProps.matches, UIMatch
    • @deprecated warnings have been added to the existing data properties to point users to new loaderData properties, in preparation for removing the data properties in a future major release

Patch Changes

  • Prevent "Did not find corresponding fetcher result" console error when navigating during a fetcher.submit revalidation (#14114)

  • Bubble client-side middleware errors prior to next to the appropriate ancestor error boundary (#14138)

  • Switch Lazy Route Discovery manifest URL generation to usea standalone URLSearchParams instance instead of URL.searchParams to avoid a major performance bottleneck in Chrome (#14084)

  • Adjust internal RSC usage of React.use to avoid Webpack compilation errors when using React 18 (#14113)

  • Remove dependency on @types/node in TypeScript declaration files (#14059)

  • Fix types for UIMatch to reflect that the loaderData/data properties may be undefined (#12206)

    • When an ErrorBoundary is being rendered, not all active matches will have loader data available, since it may have been their loader that threw to trigger the boundary
    • The UIMatch.data type was not correctly handing this and would always reflect the presence of data, leading to the unexpected runtime errors when an ErrorBoundary was rendered
    • âš ï¸ This may cause some type errors to show up in your code for unguarded match.data accesses - you should properly guard for undefined values in those scenarios.
    // app/root.tsx
export function loader() {
  someFunctionThatThrows(); // âŒ Throws an Error
  return { title: "My Title" };
}

    export function Layout({ children }: { children: React.ReactNode }) {
let matches = useMatches();
let rootMatch = matches[0] as UIMatch<Awaited<ReturnType<typeof loader>>>;
//  ^ rootMatch.data is incorrectly typed here, so TypeScript does not

... (truncated)

Commits
  • fd17d66 chore: Update version for release (#14185)
  • 68f3bfc chore: Update version for release (pre) (#14184)
  • 869e168 Propagate middleware thrown non-redirect responses to the boundary (#14182)
  • c819c77 Update logic for data->Response conversion to use Response.json (#14181)
  • bd38001 chore: Update version for release (pre) (#14178)
  • 6cce04f Merge branch 'main' into release-next
  • be95911 docs(api/hooks/useNavigate): add some extra reference links (#14170)
  • 1f06a5e Make missing loaderData conditional in Route.MetaArgs (#14173)
  • a9b539b Provide isRouteErrorResponse in react-server environments (#14166)
  • 3aee660 Properly handle data() values returned/thrown from resource routes (#14159)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

SonarQube Cloud (formerly SonarCloud) is a SaaS code analysis tool designed to detect coding issues in 30+ languages, frameworks, and IaC platforms. Your code is checked against an extensive set of rules that cover many attributes of code, such as maintainability, reliability, and security issues, on each merge/pull request.

For those requiring US-based hosting, [SonarQube Cloud US](https://sonarqube.us/) offers the perfect alternative. If you need data residency outside the US or within the EU, [SonarQube Cloud](https://sonarcloud.io/) with this GitHub app is the ideal solution.

SonarQube Cloud integrates seamlessly into your GitHub workflow and provides clear guidance for resolving any code quality and security issues detected. The majority of popular languages can be analyzed automatically; no configuration is required!

With [SonarQube Cloud](https://sonarcloud.io/github), you get:

-   Fast, precise static analysis and feedback on your code
    
-   Support for popular languages, frameworks, and IaC tools
    
-   Free analysis for open-source projects and private projects up to max 50k LoC
    
-   Automatic analysis of pull requests and branches with results reported inline
    
-   IDE Support with [SonarQube for IDE](https://www.sonarsource.com/products/sonarlint/) integration
    
-   Quality Gate (added as a GitHub check) acting at two different levels - first, preventing you from merging pull requests that contain issues - and later, helping you to release only clean, safe code
    
-   Sign up for SonarQube free tier and begin scanning your private and public repositories
    

A [GitHub Action](https://github.com/marketplace/actions/sonarcloud-scan) is available in the marketplace to make it easy for you (for projects where automatic analysis isn't available). SonarQube Cloud also integrates smoothly with Jenkins, CircleCI, TravisCI, CirrusCI, and many other tools.

A free tier is available that allows you to explore the benefits of SonarQube Cloud using your public and private repositories. We also provide a no-commitment, [14-day trial](https://www.sonarsource.com/products/sonarcloud/signup/) of SonarQube Cloud Team for unlimited team members, up to 1.9M LoC, AI CodeFix recommendations, and more. No need to speak with a sales rep or request a license key - get automatic code analysis results on your private projects in minutes! Want to see more examples of SonarCloud in action? You can [explore current Open Source projects in SonarCloud](https://sonarcloud.io/explore/projects?sort=-analysis_date) that are using the [Clean as You Code](https://www.sonarsource.com/solutions/our-unique-approach/) methodology.

What are you waiting for? SonarQube Cloud helps you consistently deliver cleaner, secure software that future developers will appreciate and your users will love. Start writing Clean Code. [Now](https://www.sonarsource.com/products/sonarcloud/signup/)!

issue.title: MMEX Flatpak: Main Screen Data Not Displaying with NVIDIA Proprietary Drivers (GBM Buffer Error)
issue.body:
MMEX version:
 - [ ] 1.7.0
 - [ ] 1.8.0
 - [] 1.8.1
 - [ ] 1.8.2
 - [x] 1.9.0
 - [ ] Other (please specify)

Note: bug reporters are expected to have verified the bug still exists
either in the last stable version of MMEX or on updated development code
(master branch).

Operating System:
 - [] Windows
 - [ ] Mac OSX
 - [x ] Linux 

# Description of the bug

Please describe your issue with details.
Add screenshot or other files if needed.

Here's a draft for your bug report to the MMEX Money Manager Flatpak developers. Remember to fill in the placeholders like your specific NVIDIA driver version and the result of your Xorg/Wayland test.

Subject: MMEX Flatpak: Main Screen Data Not Displaying with NVIDIA Proprietary Drivers (GBM Buffer Error)

Description:
When running MMEX Money Manager as a Flatpak application, the main data display area (the right side of the application, showing the Income and Expense Chart) remains blank or empty. This issue occurs specifically when the NVIDIA proprietary drivers are active on the system. Interestingly, if the NVIDIA proprietary drivers are not loaded (e.g., when Secure Boot is enabled, forcing the use of Nouveau or generic drivers), the application displays correctly.

Steps to Reproduce:

Ensure Secure Boot is disabled in the system's UEFI/BIOS.

Boot into Linux Mint (or any other distribution with NVIDIA proprietary drivers installed and active).

Verify NVIDIA proprietary drivers are loaded (e.g., by running nvidia-smi and confirming it shows GPU info).

Launch MMEX Money Manager Flatpak (flatpak run org.moneymanagerex.MMEX).

Observe the main data display area within the application.

Expected Behavior:
The main screen of MMEX Money Manager should display the user's financial data (accounts, transactions, etc.) as expected.

Actual Behavior:
The main data display area on the MMEX Money Manager screen remains blank/empty. No data is rendered or visible in this section. The rest of the application's UI (menus, buttons, sidebars) appears to load correctly.

Error Message from Terminal (when running flatpak run org.moneymanagerex.MMEX):

Gtk-Message: [TIMESTAMP]: Failed to load module "xapp-gtk3-module"
Gtk-Message: [TIMESTAMP]: Failed to load module "xapp-gtk3-module"
Failed to create GBM buffer of size 1534x809: Argumento invÃ¡lido

(Note: The Gtk-Message lines are likely warnings and not the root cause. The Failed to create GBM buffer is the critical error.)

System Information:

Operating System: Linux Mint 22.1 / Ubuntu 24.04 - 25.04

Desktop Environment: Cinnamon - Gnome

Kernel Version: 6.8.0-63-generic - 6.14.xx-generic

GPU: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060 Ti

NVIDIA Driver Version: 570.133.07

MMEX Money Manager Flatpak Version: [You can get this with flatpak list | grep MMEX]

Flatpak Version: 1.14.6

Windowing System: X11

Context/Additional Observations:

This issue does not occur when Secure Boot is enabled, as this prevents the NVIDIA proprietary drivers from loading, and the system falls back to using the Nouveau open-source driver (or a generic driver). In that scenario, MMEX displays correctly.

The problem specifically arises when the NVIDIA proprietary drivers are active.

All Flatpak permissions for MMEX have been enabled via Flatseal (including filesystem=host or filesystem=home, sockets=x11, sockets=wayland, devices=dri), but the issue persists.

The Failed to create GBM buffer error suggests a low-level graphics rendering issue, possibly related to how MMEX (or its underlying UI toolkit) interacts with the NVIDIA proprietary driver's GBM implementation.


# Reproduction

Is the bug reproducible? 
 - [x] Always 
 - [ ] Randomly 
 - [ ] Happened only once

Reproduction steps:

Expected result:

Actual result:

# Additional information

If you have a backtrace for a crash or a warning, paste it here

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7e79c311-29c0-4452-8e63-f9273c6842f8)

comment.body:
> LinuxMint 22.1 Xia, MMEX 1.9.1 Beta I have the same problem with a "NVIDIA GeForce GTX 960M" model. I have deactivated the nvidia driver. For the moment. Do you tried with the two profil of Nvidia ? On demand and the other. For the "Failed to load module "xapp-gtk3-module" message, you should add in the flatpak command line : --env=GTK3_MODULES= after the run option

This looks similar to the old known bug:
https://github.com/moneymanagerex/moneymanagerex/issues/6396#issuecomment-1913278454
